page.title: 01GAZATTEER
page.content:
The villages of Gullane and Dirleton are bordered on the landward side by fields and golf courses and on the seaward side by sandy beaches. Gullane is the larger village with a variety of shops and services while Dirleton, since the building of the by-pass, has few services or shops. Main expansion of Gullane has occurred in the last thirty years but Dirleton, apart from the occasional new house, has hardly changed in fifty years. The safe, sandy beaches and links golf courses make Gullane an attractive tourist area.The famous Muirfield Golf Course is situated on the north-east boundary of the village.
All of the information contained in the following pages was researched and collated by the P6 and P7 pupils of Gullane Primary School, June 1985.
